entry.title: Combined summary - libcoin (HEAD) now supports boost < 1.47 - please test
entry.summary: Michael Gronager, the Director of Ceptacle, has made changes to the boost::asio::signal_set to enable compilation on most currently deployed Linux systems that use Boost 1.42. He has also updated the root CMakeLists.txt to only require version 1.42. However, he acknowledges that committers' machines may have intrinsic magic that hides actual errors and encourages testing and feedback regarding the updates.In an email conversation on February 2nd, 2012, Michael Grønager explains that enabling dynamic libraries was on his to-do list, but it's not yet supported on Windows. He also expresses his frustration with Windows, explaining that you need to prepend class definitions with __declspec(dllexport) when you compile the dll and __declspec(dllimport) when you use the dll. Michael mentions that another issue with DLLs is that if you define a global variable, it is shared between all executables using this dll.Luke-Jr found that the problem in the code was that static libraries were being used instead of shared libraries, which is not best practice since most distros do not have static libraries installed by default. A patch was created to fix the issue, commenting out the lines that set Boost_USE_STATIC_LIBS and QT4_FOUND in the CMakeLists.txt files. CoinQt stuff was also causing issues, which was fixed in the patch.Michael Grønager provides his contact information at Ceptacle for any queries or feedback.
